concept.title: Administrative concepts
concept.shortdesc: Internet Scale Messaging is designed to scale to handle large numbers of users, connections, destinations, and subscriptions. Administration can be done through a graphical, or command-line interface.

conbody.p: The administrative interface is used for configuring, controlling, and monitoring large numbers of users, connections, destinations, and subscriptions. The interface provides concepts and mechanisms to enable the administrative user to avoid having to iterate over large numbers of objects.
The interface supports aggregation and drilldown. The administrator can create queries, subscriptions, or conditions against groups of objects that they want to monitor or operate upon.

Examples of administrative tasks supported by ISM include:
Viewing the status of an individual channel
Stopping an individual channel
Viewing a subset of channels
Viewing the status of all queues on a particular appliance
Drilling down into a set of queues for troubleshooting purposes
For more information about administering, see the Administering section.
